Definition at line 209 of file Transform.cpp.

double Aquila::Transform::fft ( const Frame *  frame,
spectrumType &  spectrum 
)

Calculates FFT of a signal frame using radix-2 algorithm.

Input data is given as a pointer to Frame object. Output spectrum is written to the spectrum vector, which must be initialized prior to the call to fft(). The spectrum is normalized by N/2, wher N is input frame length (zero-padded). The method returns maximum magnitude of the calculated spectrum, which can be used for example to scale a frequency plot.

Parameters:
frame pointer to Frame object
spectrum initialized complex vector of the same length as data
Returns:
maximum magnitude of the spectrum
Since:
2.0.1

Definition at line 171 of file Transform.cpp.

double Aquila::Transform::fft ( const std::vector< double > &  data,
spectrumType &  spectrum 
)

Calculates Fast Fourier Transform using radix-2 algorithm.

Input data is given as a const reference to the data vector. Output spectrum is written to the spectrum vector, which must be initialized prior to the call to fft(). The spectrum is normalized by N/2, wher N is input data length. The method returns maximum magnitude of the calculated spectrum, which can be used for example to scale a frequency plot.

Parameters:
data const reference to input data vector
spectrum initialized complex vector of the same length as data
Returns:
maximum magnitude of the spectrum

Definition at line 72 of file Transform.cpp.

double Aquila::Transform::frameLogEnergy ( const Frame *  frame  ) 

Calculates logarithm of a frame energy.

Energy is a sum of squares of all samples in the frame.

Parameters:
frame pointer to Frame object
Returns:
frame log energy (when greater than 0)

Calculates frame power.

Frame power is the energy normalized by frame length.
